study_id.description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study

institutionCode.description: The code or abbreviation representing the lead institution responsible for the study.
institutionCode.error: Name or acronym of institution is required

title.description: An official title for the study or project. Project title should be fewer than 30 words, such as a title of a grant proposal or a publication.
title.example: Study of single cells in the human body

description.description: A detailed description of the project which includes research goals and experimental approach. Project description should be fewer than 300 words, such as an abstract from a grant application or publication.
description.example: This project explores the intricate details of single cells in the human body, focusing on their structure, function, and behavior. By studying individual cells, it aims to uncover how they contribute to overall health, disease progression, and human biology. This research can provide deeper insights into cellular processes, paving the way for advancements in medical treatments and personalised medicine.

bibliographicCitation.description: A citation for the study resource, following a standard format.
bibliographicCitation.example: Doe J., et al. (2024). Single Cell Transcriptomic Analysis of Human Liver Cells. Journal of Cellular Biology.

created.description: The date when the study was created or registered.
created.error: Date study was created is required

technology.description: The sorting or visualisation technology used.

workflow.description: The workflow or protocol followed during the study.

study_id.description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the study.

sample_id.description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier assigned to the sample in the study.

strain.description: The strain of the organism, if applicable.

tissue.description: The type of tissue sampled for the study.

preservation_method.description: A brief description of how the sample was preserved.

collection_date.description: The date when the sample was collected with year, month and day specified in the format, YYYY-MM-DD.

geographic_location_latitude.description: The geographic latitude where the specimen or sample was taken in decimal degrees, between -90 and 90. Locations should be specified to a minimum of 3 decimal places and a maximum of 8 decimal places. Reference: https: //en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decimal_degree.

geographic_location_longitude.description: The geographic longitude where the specimen or sample was taken in decimal degrees, between -180 and 180. Locations should be specified to a minimum of 3 decimal places and maximum of 8 decimal places. Reference: https: //en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decimal_degrees.

broad_scale_environmental_context.description: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). Reference: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.
broad_scale_environmental_context.error: Broad scale environmental context is required

local_scale_environmental_context.description: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. Reference: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.
local_scale_environmental_context.error: Local scale environmental context is required

environmental_medium.description: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. Reference: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

AgeClass.description: The age class of the organism at the time of collection.

dissociation_protocol_id.description: A unique alphanumeric code for the dissociation protocol in the study

protocol_name.description: A descriptive name of the protocol used for single-cell sequencing.

dissociation_description.description: A free-text description of the process used to separate cells from tissues or cell aggregates.
dissociation_description.example: Tissue was enzymatically dissociated using collagenase for 30 minutes.

enrichment_markers.description: A free-text description of the markers used to enrich specific cell types during single-cell isolation.

isolation_kit.description: The kit used to isolate the cells.

literature_source_reference.description: Reference to literature sources that describe the protocol or methods used.
literature_source_reference.example: Doe et al. (2024), 'Single-cell RNA-seq: A comprehensive overview'

protocols_io_reference.description: Reference link to protocols.io for additional details on the protocol.

workflow_hub_SOP_reference.description: Reference to the Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) in workflow hub.
workflow_hub_SOP_reference.error: Workflow hub SOP reference is required.

dissociation_protocol_method.description: The method used to dissociate tissues into single cells.

single_cell_quality_metric.description: Metrics used to assess the quality of single cells before sequencing.
single_cell_quality_metric.error: Single Cell Quality Metric is required

sample_id.description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier assigned to the cell suspension for the sample in the study.

dissociation_protocol_id.description: A unique alphanumeric code for the dissociation protocol in the study

cell_suspension_id.description: A unique alphanumeric code for the cell suspension for the sample

suspension_type.description: The type of suspension used to keep cells in solution during processing.

cell_count.description: An integer representing the number of cells in the sequencing library.”

cell_size.description: The size of the cell, typically measured in micrometers.

suspension_volume_\u00b5l.description: The volume of the cell suspension in microliters.

suspension_concentration_cells_per_\u00b.description: The concentration of cells in the suspension.
suspension_concentration_cells_per_\u00b.error: Suspension concentration cells per Μl is required

suspension_dilution.description: The dilution factor of the cell suspension.

suspension_dilution_method.description: The method used to dilute the cell suspension.

suspension_dilution_buffer.description: The buffer used for diluting the cell suspension

suspension_dilution_buffer_concentration.description: The concentration of the dilution buffer used.
suspension_dilution_buffer_concentration.error: Suspension dilution buffer concentration is required

suspension_dilution_buffer_concentration.description: The unit of measurement for the dilution buffer concentration.
suspension_dilution_buffer_concentration.error: Suspension Dilution Buffer Concentration Unit is required

single_cell_identifier.description: A unique identifier assigned to each single cell.

library_preparation_id.description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the library preparation protocol used during the sequencing.

cell_suspension_id.description: A unique alphanumeric code for the cell suspension for the sample

library_preparation_kit.description: The kit used for library preparation.

library_preparation_kit_version.description: The version number of the library preparation kit used for sequencing.
library_preparation_kit_version.error: Library preparation kit version is required

i5_sequence.description: The nucleotide sequence of the i5 index used in multiplexing during sequencing.

i7_sequence.description: The nucleotide sequence of the i7 index used in multiplexing during sequencing.

amplification_method.description: The method used to amplify the cDNA, e.g. "PCR".

cDNA_amplification_cycles.description: The number of cycles used during the cDNA amplification process.

average_size_distribution.description: The average size of the DNA fragments generated during library preparation.

library_construction_method.description:
The library construction method (including version) that
was used, e.g. "Smart-Seq2", "Drop-Seq", "10X v3".

input_molecule.description:
The specific fraction of biological macromolecule from
which the sequencing library is derived, e.g. "polyA
RNA".

primer.description:
The type of primer used for reverse transcription, e.g.
"oligo-dT" or "random" primer. This allows users to
identify content of the cDNA library input, e.g. enriched
for mRNA.

end_bias.description: The end bias of the library, e.g. "5'" or "3'".

library_strand.description: The strand from which the library was derived.

spike_in.description:
Spike-in RNAs are RNA molecules with known
sequence that are added to the cell lysis mix. For instance, the
External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) spike in set
is commonly used in scRNA-seq experiments.

spike_in_dilution_or_concentration.description: The final concentration or dilution (for commercial sets) of the spike in mix.
spike_in_dilution_or_concentration.error: Spike in dilution or concentration is required

sequencing_reference.description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the sequencing protocol.

sequencing_platform_name.description: The name of the sequencing platform used for the experiment.

sequencing_instrument_model.description: This refers to the machine or platform used for sequencing, with variations in throughput, read lengths, error rates, and application suitability.

library_layout.description: The type of library layout used for sequencing.

reads_per_sample.description: The number of sequencing reads generated per sample.

technical_replicate_group_or_library_ref.description: A common term for all runs or files belonging to the same cell or library. It is recommended to use a stable sample accession from a biosample archive like BioSample. Alternatively, the library ID can be referenced from which the files were generated.
technical_replicate_group_or_library_ref.error: Technical replicate group or library reference is required

schemaorg.label: Technical Replicate Group or Library Reference
schemaorg.name: technical_replicate_group_or_library_reference

UMI_barcode_read.description: The type of read that contains the Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI) barcode.

UMI_barcode_offset.description: The offset in sequence of the Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI) identifying barcode.

UMI_barcode_size.description: The size of the Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI) identifying barcode.

cell_barcode_read.description: The type of read that contains the UMI barcode.

cell_barcode_offset.description: The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode.

cell_barcode_size.description: The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode.

cDNA_read.description: The actual nucleotide sequence obtained from Complementary DNA (cDNA) during sequencing.

cDNA_read_offset.description: The starting position of the Complementary DNA (cDNA) read within the entire sequence, indicating where the read begins after any barcodes or technical sequences.

cDNA_read_size.description: The size of the Complementary DNA (cDNA) read.

sample_barcode_read.description: The type of read that contains the sample barcode.

sample_barcode_offset.description: The offset in sequence of the sample identifying barcode.

sample_barcode_size.description: The size of the read that contains the sample barcode.

library_preparation_id.description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the library preparation protocol used during the sequencing.

sequencing_reference.description: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the sequencing protocol.

read_1_file.description: The name of the file that contains read 1.

read_2_file.description: The name of the file that contains read 2.

index_1_file.description: The name of the file that contains index 1.

index_2_file.description: The name of the file that contains index 2.

checksum.description: Result of a hash function calculated on the file content to assert file integrity. Commonly used algorithms are MD5 and SHA-1.

white_list_barcode_file.description:
A file containing the known cell barcodes in the
dataset.
white_list_barcode_file.error: White List Barcode File is required

file_derived_from.description: The name of the file that was used to generate the analysis derived data.

inferred_cell_type.description: Post analysis cell type or identity declaration based on expression profile or known gene function identified by the performer.

post_analysis_cell_well_quality.description:
Performer defined measure of whether the read output
from the cell was included in the sequencing analysis. For example, cells might be excluded if a threshold percentage of reads did not map to the genome or if pre-sequencing quality measures were not passed.
post_analysis_cell_well_quality.error: Post analysis cell well quality is required

other_derived_cell_attributes.description: Any other cell level measurement or annotation as result of the analysis.
other_derived_cell_attributes.error: Other derived cell attributes is required
